锋铓 [ fēng máng ]: variant of 锋芒
(Trad.: 鋩)
Ideographic: A metal 钅 blade 芒; 芒 also provides the pronunciation
Freq: 6941
Hanzi: 鋩
铓又称冬锣。通体用青铜铸成，圆盘形，中心突起呈半球形乳状，铓面不平坦，边缘部分也有一圈突起，铓边比其它锣稍宽。铓体大小不一，规格较多。常见的铓一般可分为大、中、小三种。 大铓面径40厘米、边宽6厘米、乳脐直径7厘米、乳高5厘米；中铓面径30厘米、边宽5厘米、乳脐直径6.5厘米、乳高4厘米；小铓面径20厘米、边宽3.5厘米、乳径6厘米、乳高3厘米。铓面边缘突起高度0.5厘米～1厘米，铓边一侧钻孔系绳。此外，最小的铓，面径仅9厘米、边宽1厘米，音高可达a2；最大的铓，面径72厘米、边宽14 厘米，音低可到F或G。
Shuo is also called Dong Gong. The whole body is made of bronze, with a disc shape, the central protrusion is hemispherical and milky, the ram surface is not flat, and there is also a circle of protrusions at the edge, and the rim is slightly wider than other gongs. The size of the body is different, and the specifications are more. The common types of iron can generally be divided into three types: large, medium and small. The large side diameter is 40 cm, the side width is 6 cm, the navel diameter is 7 cm, and the breast height is 5 cm; the middle side diameter is 30 cm, the side width is 5 cm, the navel diameter is 6.5 cm, and the breast height is 4 cm; the small side diameter is 20 cm, side width 3.5 cm, breast diameter 6 cm, breast height 3 cm. The height of the protrusion on the edge of the ring surface is 0.5 cm to 1 cm, and the tether is drilled on one side of the ring side. In addition, the smallest globule has a face diameter of only 9 cm and a side width of 1 cm, and the pitch can reach a2; the largest globule has a face diameter of 72 cm and a side width of 14 cm, and the pitch can be as low as F or G.

铓字的基本解释

铓
（鋩）
máng
刀剑等的尖端；锋刃：锋铓。剑铓。
光芒：“雄戟耀铓。”

铓字的汉语字典释义

[①]［máng］
［《廣韻》武方切，平陽，微。］
亦作“釯1”。“铓1”的繁体字。
(1)刀剑等的尖锋。亦借指刀剑等。
(2)物体外部的尖端部分。
(3)光芒。
(4)一种民间敲击乐器，流行于云南省傣族和景颇族地区。

铓字的康熙字典解释
铓字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体韩国明朝体
铓字的起名意思

刀剑等的尖锋。亦借指刀剑等；物体外部的尖端部分；光芒；一种民间敲击乐器，流行于云南省傣族和景颇族地区。

铓
Basic explanation of words
铓
(铓)
máng
The tip of a sword, etc.; a sharp edge: a sharp edge. Swordsman.
Light: "The male halberd shines."
铓
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①] [máng]
["Guangyun" Wu Fangqie, Pingyang, Wei. ]
Also known as "釯1". Traditional characters for "铓1".
(1) The sharp edges of swords and so on. Also refer to swords and so on.
(2) The tip part outside the object.
(3) Light.
(4) A folk percussion instrument popular in the Dai and Jingpo areas of Yunnan Province.
